famous_recipes.method: To make Shahi Merton, first boil milk and add sugar to create a thick and creamy base. Then, soak almonds in hot water and peel off the skin before grinding them into a fine paste. Add the almond paste to the milk mixture and cook until the mixture thickens. In a separate pan, heat ghee and fry small pieces of mawa until they turn golden brown.

To prepare biryani, first, soak 2 cups of basmati rice for 30 minutes, then cook the rice with whole spices and salt until it's 70% done. In a separate pan, cook the meat or vegetables with spices and yoghurt until tender. Layer the rice and meat mixture in a large pot, sprinkle with fried onions, mint leaves, and saffron-infused milk. Cover and cook on low heat for 20-25 minutes until the rice is fully cooked and fluffy. Serve hot with raita or salad.

To make Chicken Tandoori, start by marinating chicken in a mixture of yogurt, tandoori masala, ginger-garlic paste, cumin, coriander, garam masala, and salt. Refrigerate the chicken for at least 2 hours or overnight to allow the flavors to develop. Preheat your oven to 400°F and arrange the chicken on a baking sheet. Roast the chicken in the oven for 20-25 minutes or until fully cooked and slightly charred. Once the chicken is cooked, you can serve it hot with naan bread or as a side dish. Chicken Tandoori is a popular Indian dish that is flavorful, tender, and easy to make at home.

Matar Paneer is a popular North Indian dish made with soft cubes of cottage cheese (paneer) and green peas (matar) in a creamy tomato-based gravy. To prepare it, first, heat oil in a pan and sauté onions, ginger, and garlic until golden brown. Then, add tomatoes, spices, and cook until they soften. Next, add green peas and water, cover and cook until tender. Finally, add paneer, cream, and simmer until the gravy thickens.

To prepare Chicken Kosha, marinate chicken with turmeric, chili powder, and salt. Fry the chicken until golden brown and set aside. In the same pan, sauté whole spices, sliced onions, ginger, garlic, and green chilies. Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric, chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and cook until the tomatoes soften. Add water and simmer until the gravy thickens. Finally, add the fried chicken, cover and simmer until cooked through. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with rice.

To make Chicken Tandoori, start by marinating chicken in a mixture of yogurt, tandoori masala, ginger-garlic paste, cumin, coriander, garam masala, and salt. Refrigerate the chicken for at least 2 hours or overnight to allow the flavors to develop. Preheat your oven to 400°F and arrange the chicken on a baking sheet. Roast the chicken in the oven for 20-25 minutes or until fully cooked and slightly charred. Once the chicken is cooked, you can serve it hot with naan bread or as a side dish. Chicken Tandoori is a popular Indian dish that is flavorful, tender, and easy to make at home.
